definitions.definition: A small unfretted stringed instrument with four strings tuned ( lowest to highest ) G - D - A - E , usually held against the chin and played with a bow .
examples: When I play it like this, it's a fiddle ; when I play it like this, it's a violin .

definitions.definition: Any instrument of the violin family , always inclusive of violins, violas and cellos , and sometimes further including the double bass .
examples: The string quartet , one of the most popular groupings in chamber music , is composed entirely of violins : two violins proper, one viola , and one cello .

definitions.definition: A violinist in an orchestra or group .
examples: The violins are seated with sufficient elbow room.
She is first violin in the London Symphony Orchestra.

main_definition: ( music ) A small unfretted stringed instrument with four strings tuned ( lowest to highest ) G - D - A - E , usually held against the chin and played with a bow .
secondary_definitions: ( inexact , sometimes proscribed ) Any instrument of the violin family , always inclusive of violins, violas and cellos , and sometimes further including the double bass .
( music , metonymic ) A violinist in an orchestra or group .
